Underwriting is a very important aspect of our
business. Most people in our industry need to
understand the basics around underwriting authority
in the application. How does it work?

| Underwriting authority Gi

¢ Provides underwriting rules and an underwriting infrastructure to manage
underwriting issues

¢ Major components
« Underwriting Issue — A specific occurrence on a policy transaction where an underwriting
condition was true.

« Underwriting Rule — Describes how the policy transaction is affected by underwriting issues
and how issues can be approved. The rules include the conditions which will raise an
underwriting issue.

¢ Authority Grant — The ability to approve underwriting issues and to what degree.

¢ Authority Profile — A group of authorities that can be given to a user, allowing the user to
approve underwriting issues.

Underwriting issues i

yN
©).

* Created when a condition gives undesirable results
based on data on the policy or account such as:

* a level of coverage or price of a coverable or
* a jurisdiction or
* more complex issue such as drivers in urban areas

* Can stop jobs unless approved

| Creating underwriting issues

« Raised automatically based on policy choices

« UWrules trigger UW issues
+ Rule conditions can be created in the UW rule user interfaces

+ More complex conditions can be written in Gosu code
« Automatically removed when the condition is resolved
* Can be added manually on the UW Issues screen

* Manual issues are not removed automatically

| Checking set

¢« Achecking set represents a point in a job where issues can be raised
* pre-quote
* bind
* pre-issuance, etc.

¢ Used to specify when to check if an issue exists

| Blocking point

¢ Ablocking point stops progress of the job until an issue is approved

submission quote, bind or issue bound and issued

* Specific issue types can be configured as informational (non-blocking)

* Agent can progress further in job
